result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Arthur Lee Ankebrant in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Edward Weil in court for Arthur Lee Ankebrant.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Court grants Attorney Laatsch's motion to withdraw.  Adjourned to allow time for discovery and pretrial.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Order on Attorney Drewa's Motion to Withdraw

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Arthur Lee Ankebrant appears in custody and by Attorney Timothy Drewa in person.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned to review discovery and pretrial.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with J.C.C., N.A.C., K.A.H.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Arthur Lee Ankebrant appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Arthur Lee Ankebrant. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Court addresses potential recusal issue, defendant waives right to recusal for purposes of proceeding with this hearing and SPD and State waive recusal for purposes of this hearing. Court notes recusal has been waived and proceeds.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender and if there are no conflicts they will appoint an attorney.  Court sets $2500 sig bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
